text:
“How can you do without signing it?”  

“I don’t want the money.”  

“That’s nonsense. He’s traveling again.”  

“Let me come another time.”  

“No, no. You’re a man of judgment.”  

Raskolnikov hesitated.  

“Stop, I’ll do it alone.”  

He took the pen and signed.  

The messenger pocketed the money and left.  

“Are you hungry?”  

“Yes.”  

“Is there soup?”  

“Some from yesterday.”  

“With potatoes and rice?”  

“Yes.”  

Raskolnikov felt astonished and terrified.  

“I believe this is reality,” he thought.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov experiences a mix of astonishment and terror as he navigates a mundane interaction involving money and food, questioning his grasp on reality.
